meanings.definition: Make as large or great as possible.
meanings.sent1: She maximised her savings by putting money into a high-interest account.
meanings.sent2: The farmer maximised his crop yield by using advanced farming techniques.
meanings.sent3: The student maximised her chances of success by studying diligently for the exam.
meanings.sent4: The coach maximised the team's potential by implementing a new training program.
meanings.sent5: The chef maximised the flavor of the dish by adding a secret ingredient.

meanings.definition: Make the best or most effective use of.
meanings.sent1: He maximised his time by creating a schedule for his tasks.
meanings.sent2: The company maximised its profits by investing in innovative technology.
meanings.sent3: The cat maximised its nap time by finding the sunniest spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: The artist maximised the use of colors in the painting to create a vibrant masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The teacher maximised student engagement by incorporating interactive activities into the lesson.
